attributes.action: stricter laws -Umbrella companies unlawfully forcing workers to pay employers NI
attributes.additional_details:
Umbrella companies are profiting from this circumstance by enforcing employee’s to unlawfully pay employers NI . As well as this, several umbrella companies have tampered with pay slips, placing employees on minimum wage whilst paying the rest of the wages on a “assignment commission “ basis . 
Individuals are seeing an upto 40-50% total tax deduction taken from earnings , with no PAYEE benefits and no where to turn .
attributes.background: Since the roll out of IR35 April 2021, many contractors working for the public sector have been blanket deemed inside IR35 by agencies or employers. As a result of this , many individuals have been given little to no option other than to move onto an umbrella scheme based payroll system.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Introduce a statutory regulator for IR35 assessments: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/574730

Ban the use of umbrella companies in the construction industry: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/583053

Change IR35 rules to require client to pay employer NI: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/582935
